description.plain:
With a name to match the object that hides his face, the immensely popular DJ known as Marshmello (who began his career in 2015) has risen to fame faster than many artists. He operates under his own label, Joytime Collective, and has signed two other artists to the label so far: Slushii and Papa Khan.

Marshmello released his debut album, Joytime, on January 8, 2016, and has not looked back since. After his song “Alone” went viral in 2016, Marshmello has been dominating the EDM scene and has even entered the pop world with songs such as “Silence,” “FRIENDS,”, “Wolves” and “Happier.”

body.plain:
With a name to match the object that hides his face, the immensely popular DJ known as Marshmello (who began his career in 2015) has risen to fame faster than many artists. He operates under his own label, Joytime Collective, and has signed two other artists to the label so far: Slushii and Papa Khan.

Marshmello released his debut album, Joytime, on January 8, 2016, and has not looked back since. After his song “Alone” went viral in 2016, Marshmello has been dominating the EDM scene and has even entered the pop world with songs such as “Silence,” “FRIENDS,”, “Wolves” and “Happier.”

songs.title: Silence

description.plain:
A collab that Marshmello had hinted at dating back to July 22, 2017, “Silence” tells the story of someone struggling with their emotional well-being and confidence in developing relationships. As the song progresses to the chorus, Khalid expresses the strength that the storyteller has found to overcome their fears of talking and deciding to break the “silence” they’ve felt trapped in up until now.

The song peaked at #30 on the Billboard Hot 100 charts.

songs.lyrics:
146 ContributorsSilence Lyrics[Verse 1]
Yeah, I'd rather be a lover than a fighter (Fighter)
'Cause all my life, I've been fighting
Never felt a feeling of comfort, oh
And all this time, I've been hiding
And I never had someone to call my own, oh nah
I'm so used to sharing
Love only left me alone
But I'm at one with the silence

[Chorus]
I found peace in your violence
Can't tell me there's no point in trying
I'm at one, and I've been quiet for too long
I found peace in your violence
Can't tell me there's no point in trying
I'm at one, and I've been silent for too long
[Drop]
I've been quiet for too long
I've been quiet for too long
I found peace in your violence
Can't tell me there's no point in trying
I'm at one, and I've been quiet for too long

[Verse 2]
I'm in need of a savior (Savior), but I'm not asking for favors
My whole life, I've felt like a burden
I think too much, and I hate it
I'm so used to being in the wrong, I'm tired of caring
Loving never gave me a home, so I'll sit here in the silence

[Chorus]
I found peace in your violence
Can't tell me there's no point in trying
I'm at one, and I've been quiet for too long
I found peace in your violence
Can't tell me there's no point in trying

songs.title: Alone

description.plain:
“Alone” is a yearning EDM banger about missing home and the person you love. It’s the first release on Canadian EDM label Monstercat for Marshmello—a masked DJ who came on the scene in 2015.

“Alone” dropped in May 2016, just days before Marshmello performed at EDC New York. Marshmello revealed the meaning of this song on Facebook:

Truth is, I had just moved away from my friends and family and I started to feel very home sick and lonely like I didn’t belong in my new settings. Everything was just happening so fast and I couldn’t really grasp where I was or who I was but all I knew was that I felt Alone.

songs.embed_content: Read “Alone” by Marshmello on Genius

songs.full_title: Keep It Mello by Marshmello (Ft. Omar LinX)
songs.title: Keep It Mello

description.plain: Keep It Mello is a song in Marshmello’s 2016 album JOYTIME. It was one of his first big hits. The song’s music video was first uploaded to a YouTube channel called “Trap Nation”, and has more than 300 million views as of December, 2018. In the song, Omar LinX, the collaborator on this song, talks about hanging out late nights, and basically having fun.

songs.embed_content: Read “Keep It Mello” by Marshmello on Genius
